text:
The buffet is very good value for money. Best place to try all the 3 types of cooking styles, Japanese, Chinese, Malaysian. All of their skewers are very well done. Their Chinese cooked dishes are a bit lacking, but Malaysian dishes are very good.

I did not try their hotpot, but I see almost every table ordered their hotpot, so I think it should be good as well. Highly recommend this place as I love places that make use of similar ingredients in different cooking styles. As what the other patrons commented, the place is crowded and noisy. Not for those that prefer a place for chatting.

I'm thoroughly impressed with Artistick Restaurant! The service was top-notch, with friendly and attentive staff who made sure our dining experience was exceptional.

But what truly stole the show was the food - authentic, delicious, and a wide variety to choose from. The local dishes were expertly prepared and presented, and we enjoyed every bite.

The best part? Amazing value for money! For just $28, you can enjoy all the steamboat dishes, and for an additional $10, you can top up for sticks and dishes from their menu.

And to quench your thirst, they offer a variety of drinks, including:

- Beer tower available for purchase
- Free-flow juices (blackcurrant, fruit punch, orange juice)
- Water and ice, available at no extra charge!

Whether you're a foodie or just looking for a great meal, Artistick Restaurant is a must-visit. Highly recommended!

Whether you're a foodie or just looking for a great meal, Artistick Restaurant is a must-visit. Highly recommended!

Faye

Went on a friday night. The wait was disgustingly long estimated 2h. Longest i have ever dined in was three hours and 30minutes. Food was not bad and service was ok. $38 buffet must add $6 then got steamboat. They should have told the waiting time before hand so that customers would know whether to dine in. At least the guy serving was helpful in rushing the kitchen but i hope they have a better ordering system

Food is good, quite big portions. Prawns for steamboat not very fresh but the grilled ones were tasty, well seasoned. The spicy fried duck with dried chilli and Pork broth for the steamboat is nice. Recommended place to go

Perfect place for dining with friends & family with wide variety of options available ranging from chuan chuan to lok lok to satay and even yakitori skewers! We opted for the $38 buffet menu and ordered many tze char dishes too! ðŸ¥° Love that they have mentaiko items too such as mentaiko prawns, scallop, squid!

A fan of biscuit ice cream and love that they offer that as dessert in the buffet menu!
